content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I searched for scientific consensus on the risks of consuming seafood caught in the Pacific Ocean after the release of treated nuclear wastewater from the Fukushima Dai'ichi nuclear power plant and found several sources, including articles from BBC, The Guardian, and the International Atomic Energy Agency. I also browsed a website and found two research papers published in the Journal of Disaster Research, one discussing residents' understanding of the risks of consuming seafood from the Pacific Ocean after the Fukushima Dai'ichi nuclear power plant disaster. The website also included articles on incident command systems, sociocultural factors in urban search and rescue teams, and excess mortality possibly due to COVID-19 in Tokyo.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "potential risks of consuming seafood caught in the Pacific Ocean after the release of treated nuclear wastewater from the Fukushima Dai\'ichi nuclear power plant"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.fda.gov/news-events/public-health-focus/fda-response-fukushima-daiichi-nuclear-power-facility-incident", "https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9659344/", "https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/19/asia/japan-fukushima-disaster-wastewater-fishing-concerns-hnk-dst-dg-intl/index.html", "https://apnews.com/article/japan-fukushima-daiichi-radioactive-water-release-75becaaf68b7c3faf0121c459fdd25af", "https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-56728068", "https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/feb/15/fukushima-japan-insists-release-of-treated-water-is-safe-nuclear-disaster", "https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/west-coast/science-data/fukushima-radiation-us-west-coast-tuna", "https://hakaimagazine.com/article-short/fukushima-radioactive-wastewater-dilemma/"]', type='action_result')]
"""
